intro: Alloplectus purpureus, commonly known as the purplestem sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and clusters of small, showy purple or pink flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. It has small, ovate leaves that are usually covered in fine hairs, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Alloplectus purpureus is adapted to thrive in harsh conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
